title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Amendment)
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Amendment) 

Regulations 2022. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the Health Services (Drug Payment Scheme) 
Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited 
together as the Health Services Regulations 1972 to 2022.

title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 March 2022.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 March 2022.

title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Health Services Regulations 1972 
(S.I. No. 88 of 1972); 

“Regulations of 2021” means the Health Services (Amendment) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 595 of 2021).

title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: 4. Regulation 6 (as amended by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2021)
text_raw:
4. Regulation 6 (as amended by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2021) 

of the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) 

(b) 

in paragraph (1), by substituting “€80” for “€100”, and 

in paragraph (2), by substituting “€80” for “€100” in both places 
where it occurs.

title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: 5. The Regulations of 2021 are revoked.
text_raw:
5. The Regulations of 2021 are revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th February, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [77] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 February, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 February, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health.

title: Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend Regulation 6 of the Health Service Regulations 1972 
(as substituted by Regulation 4 of the Health Services (Drug Payment Scheme) 
Regulations 2017, and subsequently amended by Regulation 4 of the Health 
Services (Amendment) Regulations 2021), by reducing the monthly copayment threshold from €100 to €80 in any calendar month, for approved 
prescribed medicines or other items supplied under the Drug Payment Scheme. 

The Regulations of 2021, which reduced the monthly co-payment from €114 to 
€100, are revoked and replaced by these Regulations. 

These Regulations come into operation on 1 March 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [77] 5
